did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Kennedy Collection 1960-2002 (bulk 1963-1992)

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: University of Arizona. Library. Special Collections.

did.abstract: The Kennedy Collection contains media and news clippings related to the Presidency of John F. Kennedy, his wife, Jacqueline Kennedy and family. The bulk of the collection pertains to the Kennedy assassination and materials related to conspiracy theory research and tracing evidence of a cover-up (predominantly newsletters).

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Kennedy Collection (MS 575). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into four series.

list.item: Series I: Correspondence, notes, ephemera, photographs and memorabilia, 1962-2001
Series II: Publications and Newsletters (commercial and self-published), 1970-2002
Series III: Newspapers, Magazines, Clippings and Oversize, 1961-2001

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection is primarily concerned with the assassination of President John F. Kennedy and the movement to research and prove that the assassination was a conspiracy/cover-up with the aim at finding the truth. The collection includes correspondence, ephemera, newsletters, publications and extensive clippings (magazine and newspaper). The collection documents the subculture of conspiracy theorists and researchers and the manner in which they shared ideas and information through various channels including small shops and self-publishing. This collection also contains audio visual materials including commercial and amateur audio cassettes, VHS tapes, CDs, DVDs and a Super 8 film. There are a limited number of photographs, mostly of the Assassination Symposium on JFK held in 1992. The strongest part of the collection is the runs of newsletters on conspiracy theories including: The Continuing Inquiry, The Third Decade, The Fourth Decade, Echoes of Conspiracy, Grassy Knoll Gazette, Investigator, and Probe. Artificial collection with donations from Gary Opper [bulk], Loretta Cramer and anonymous.

item.subject: United states. Warren Commission. Report of the President’s Commission on the Assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
Political culture – United States – History – 20th Century.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, notes, ephemera, photographs and memorabilia,

scopecontent.p: Mostly materials collected by Gary Opper. His correspondence includes many marketing materials from booksellers, other conspiracy theory researchers, and colleagues regarding the purchasing and trading of information related to the JFK Assassination.

Publications and Newsletters (commercial and self-published),

scopecontent.p: This series contains most of the conspiracy theory research and publications. Many of the newsletters series are complete runs. Of special note are the sets of book dealer catalogs.

Newspapers, Magazines, Clippings and Oversize,

scopecontent.p: Mainstream media with articles on the Kennedy’s, the Assassination of JFK, and stories about conspiracy theories and cover-ups. Includes incomplete runs of LOOK, Life, Time and Newsweek (selected for relevant content). Large collection of newspapers from November, 1963 with front cover stories. The bulk of the clippings from 1961-1963 focus on images of the Kennedy family and contain few articles.
